messages.title: Thangam Debbonaire was in your local area
messages.content:
My achievements and my priorities:

PRIORITY: Good Jobs
The world is changing and we all want to be well paid jobs in Bristol—jobs that fit with caring for our families. We need apprenticeships, and businesses must pay decent wages and conditions.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We have to do better. With Labour I led calls to hire more midwives, extend access to NHS mental services, reduce the fees charged by social care to older folks.
Everyone, especially our young people, deserves schools and colleges that are properly funded. The Tories cut budgets, closed Sure Start centres, and made education a lottery.
I published a clean air plan for Bristol. All parties approved (68% Clean Air Projects). We need long term, sustainable green changes to the city with a focus on public transport and cycling.
Campaign champion of healthy relationships (education on healthy relationships)
After a year of campaigning I helped ban unfair letting fees, saving half a million for Bristol homes

community.content: The world is changing and we all want to be well paid jobs in Bristol—jobs that fit with caring for our families. We need apprenticeships, and businesses must pay decent wages and conditions.

leaflet.personalStatement: Bristol is my home. I have lived here for 25 years and can only promise that to continue to serve all people of Bristol. It has been an honour to represent you in Westminster and wherever you vote for me again, or you were inspired to join in making a change, please don’t hesitate to get in touch.
